intro: Tripleurospermum microcephalum, commonly known as the small-headed ray flover, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, upright stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white to pale yellow, arranged in a single head with ray florets. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands.
